noun.description: A person who ropes a steer by its heels (as opposed to its head), especially in a team-roping rodeo event.
examples: when the steer runs through the loop, the heeler must quickly pull the slack out of his rope

noun.description: A sheepdog or cattle dog trained to drive animals by running or nipping at their heels.
examples: my dog is a heeler and so doesn't require much grooming
